awd_titl_txt: The Gallium/Aluminum Ratio in Rivers: A Possible New Tool inStudies of Weathering and Aluminum Geochemistry
awd_abstract_narration: There is considerable interest in the geochemistry of aluminum             because of the various roles that this major earth element plays                in the weathering process, in soil chemistry, and in stream                     chemistry.  Gallium is an element with a geochemistry and solution              chemistry similar to that of aluminum.  Thus, gallium might serve               as an analogue for aluminum.  A consideration of the available                  knowledge about gallium suggests that the slight differences                    between its chemistry and that of aluminum should lead to                       variations in the dissolved gallium/aluminum ratio in rivers.  This             variation may provide useful information regarding weathering                   processes and aluminum geochemistry.  Limited preliminary data                  indicate that variations in the gallium/aluminum ratio do occur.                We therefore propose a more thorough preliminary study of the                   behavior of gallium in rivers.
